contentrichtext.text: {{Nihongo|'''Fukiage'''|吹上町|Fukiage-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Hioki District, Kagoshima|Hioki District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On May 1, 2005 Fukiage was merged with the towns of [[Higashiichiki, Kagoshima|Higashiichiki]], [[Hiyoshi, Kagoshima|Hiyoshi]] and [[Ijūin, Kagoshima|Ijūin]], all from [[Hioki District, Kagoshima|Hioki District]], to form the new city of [[Hioki, Kagoshima|Hioki]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 9,833 and the [[population density|density]] of 101.38 persons per km². The total area was 96.99 km². == External links == * [http://www.city.hioki.kagoshima.jp/ Official website of Hioki] {{Ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
